t: Psalm 139
Search Me, O God, and Know My Heart
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s you have searched me and known me!
You*ln know when I sit down and when I rise up; you*ld discern my thoughts from afar.
You*ln search out my path and my lying down and*ld are acquainted with all my ways.
Even*ln before a word is on my tongue, behold,*ld O Lord,*s you know it altogether.
You*ln hem me in, behind and before, and*ld lay your hand upon me.
Such*ln knowledge is too wonderful for me; it*ld is high; I cannot attain it.
Where*pn shall I go from your Spirit? Or*ld where shall I flee from your presence?
If*ln I ascend to heaven, you are there! If*ld I make my bed in Sheol, you are there!
If*ln I take the wings of the morning and*ld dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
even*ln there your hand shall lead me, and*ld your right hand shall hold me.
If*ln I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me, and*ld the light about me be night,”
even*ln the darkness is not dark to you; the*ld night is bright as the day, for*ld darkness is as light with you.
For*pn you formed my inward parts; you*ld knitted me together in my mother’s womb.
I*ln praise you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Wonderful*ln are your works; my*ld soul knows it very well.
My*ln frame was not hidden from you, when*ln I was being made in secret, intricately*ld woven in the depths of the earth.
Your*ln eyes saw my unformed substance; in*ln your book were written, every one of them, the*ld days that were formed for me, when*ld as yet there was none of them.
How*pn precious to me are your thoughts, O God! How*ld vast is the sum of them!
If*ln I would count them, they are more than the sand. I*ld awake, and I am still with you.
Oh*pn that you would slay the wicked, O God! O*ld men of blood, depart from me!
They*ln speak against you with malicious intent; your*ld enemies take your name in vain.
Do*ln I not hate those who hate you, O Lord?*s And*ld do I not loathe those who rise up against you?
I*ln hate them with complete hatred; I*ld count them my enemies.
Search*pn me, O God, and know my heart! Try*ld me and know my thoughts!
And*ln see if there be any grievous way in me, and*ld lead me in the way everlasting!
